taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section sylvatici;species laciniatus;

treatment.description: More slender, with glabrescent canes, armed with broad-based curved prickles; leaves greenish or but slightly grayish beneath, the leaflets pinnately cleft into small leaflets and segments; inflorescence corymbiform or short-paniculate, armed with falcate flat prickles; calyx armed with sharp slender prickles, its lobes with long narrow foliaceous appendages; -petals 3-lobed.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Roadsides, borders of groves and waste places, esc. from cult., Mass, to Mich., and southw., Fl. June-Aug.; fr. July-Sept.
treatment.discussion: (Cult, and natzd., of Old World origin.)
